item.title: That '70s Interactive TV
The Case Of The Missing Channel
item.description: Hey guys, Ernie here with an epic find from Andrew Egan. He worked really hard on this one and I wanna give him a ton of credit here. Strap in for an epic piece. Today in Tedium: Permanence and importance are at the center of Percy Shelley’s classic poem Ozymandias. “Look upon my works ye mighty and despair,” an ancient king extols from a crumbling statue before the poem concludes. “… the long and level sands stretch far away.
